name: SEO-Optimized Blog Post Structure
approach: Structure blog posts with SEO best practices: compelling title with primary keyword (50-60 chars), meta description under 160 chars with call-to-action, single H1 matching page intent, H2/H3 hierarchy with keywords, primary keyword in first 100 words, internal/external links, structured data markup, and optimized images with descriptive alt text.
rationale: Search engines favor well-structured content with clear hierarchy, semantic relevance, and user engagement signals. This structure improves crawlability, featured snippet eligibility, and user experience metrics that influence rankings.

code_examples.meta_tags_html:
<title>Primary Keyword: Compelling Hook | Brand Name</title>
<meta name="description" content="Action-oriented description under 160 chars with keyword and CTA." />
<meta name="robots" content="index, follow" />
<link rel="canonical" href="https://example.com/blog/article-slug" />

<!-- Open Graph -->
<meta property="og:type" content="article" />
<meta property="og:title" content="Primary Keyword: Compelling Hook" />
<meta property="og:description" content="Engaging description for social sharing." />
<meta property="og:image" content="https://example.com/images/og-image.jpg" />
<meta property="og:url" content="https://example.com/blog/article-slug" />

<!-- Twitter Card -->
<meta name="twitter:card" content="summary_large_image" />
<meta name="twitter:title" content="Primary Keyword: Compelling Hook" />
<meta name="twitter:description" content="Engaging description for Twitter." />
<meta name="twitter:image" content="https://example.com/images/twitter-image.jpg" />

success_indicators: Primary keyword appears in title, H1, and first paragraph
Meta description is 150-160 characters with call-to-action
Heading hierarchy is logical (H1 > H2 > H3, no skipped levels)
JSON-LD Article schema is valid and complete
At least 2 internal links to related content
At least 1 external link to authoritative source
All images have descriptive alt text
Content is at least 1000 words for comprehensive coverage
